channel.title: Upgrading Graphics
channel.description:
Now before anyone thinks this is a stupid question, I am quite new to PC gaming and I have done some research on the internet. I have found nothing that answers my questions specifically.
Recently I have been considering upgrading my PC's graphic card, I just want to know a few things.
Will buying a new graphics card increase framerates in games(even if I dont upgrade the rest of my PC)?
Will any graphics card work in my computer?
I have a Dell, which I've heard can cause problems with upgrades, is this true?
Can you reccomend any graphics cards?(I can give my specs if requested)

item.title: Upgrading Graphics
item.dc:creator: Dust
item.description:
Thanks for the info, I will check my motherboard as soon as possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Upgrading Graphics
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Well first of all you have to check if your motherboard has a PCI-E x16 slot and then make sure your dell power supply is enough to power a high-end card.

If your dell has an AGP slot you’ll have to look for AGP cards and I suggest looking for the newest solution from AMD since they made AGP cards newer than nvidia.

In any case, a new graphics card will almost definitely increase your framerate in 3D games, but don’t expect miracles like GTA4 or Crysis.

Read full topic

item.title: Upgrading Graphics
item.dc:creator: NavMan
item.description:
We need you’re specs, specifically what sort of a motherboard you have.

Read full topic
